intro: Cypholophus rudis, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by green bracts. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Cypholophus rudis is typically shrub-like in growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
